Explained: What is the Airbus A320 software issue and why are 6,000 planes grounded
description: Airbus has grounded 6,000 A320 aircraft—half its global fleet—for emergency software fixes after discovering intense solar radiation can corrupt critical flight control systems. The unprecedented recall follows an October incident when a JetBlue flight suddenly nosedived without pilot input, forcing an emergency landing. Airlines worldwide face massive disruptions during peak travel season, with repairs taking hours for most planes but weeks for 1,000 older jets requiring hardware replacements. The incident is being hailed as the largest aircraft recall in history.

Hong Kong fire tragedy: Were authorities alerted long before? Key details
description: Residents' prior warnings about flammable materials used in renovations at Wang Fuk Court were ignored, contributing to a devastating fire that claimed at least 128 lives. The blaze rapidly spread due to the materials and malfunctioning fire alarms, leading to arrests for manslaughter and corruption as Hong Kong mourns and calls for stronger safety oversight.

Simple morning swaps can significantly improve digestion.

Liver specialist explains the medicines that should never be mixed with alcohol
description: The cocktail of alcohol and routine medications can create a recipe for disaster—compromising reflexes, burdening the liver, and triggering extreme reactions. Whether it's anti-anxiety meds, sleep enhancers, allergy medicines, or pain relief like paracetamol, the interactions can be harmful. Plus, heart, diabetes, and circulation drugs might also react unpredictably.

title: JEE, NEET and CUET in Class XI? Reforms to cut dependence on coaching on cards
description: A central panel is proposing significant reforms to reduce student reliance on coaching centres. Key suggestions include holding competitive exams as early as Class XI, limiting daily coaching to two-three hours, and exploring a hybrid assessment model combining board performance with aptitude tests. These measures aim to ease academic pressure and re-emphasize school-based learning.

title: Trinamool, BJP clash over student credit card scheme
description: CM Mamata Banerjee hails milestone as sanctioned loans cross 1 lakh; BJP alleges students caught in a broken system

title: Maharashtra local polls: SC clears election process; 50% cap upheld
description: The Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to proceed with elections for most local bodies, excluding those with over 50% reservation. Polls for 57 civic bodies exceeding this limit will be subject to the court's final decision on January 21, with results pending the outcome.

title: Hindu neighbour offers land to Muslim journalist after Jammu authority demolishes house
description: Kuldeep Sharma, a resident of Jammu’s Narwal, offered land to journalist Arfaz Daing, whose house constructed 40 years ago was demolished by the JDA for “being on encroached land” a day ago

title: MCD bypolls: Metro services to start at 4 am on polling, counting days
Harshita Brella case: UK police face misconduct proceedings; family demands answers
description: Four Northamptonshire police officers face misconduct proceedings for their handling of domestic abuse complaints made by Harshita Brella before her death. Brella reported abuse by her husband, Pankaj Lamba, who is accused of murdering her and fleeing to India. An investigation found that officers may not have adequately supported Brella, potentially contributing to the tragic outcome.

title: After two pedestrians killed in West Delhi hit-and-run, 20-year-old held; drove with no licence, say police
Airbus A320 software switch: Flight delays, cancellations likely; over 200 planes impacted
description: Airbus said intense solar radiation might corrupt data critical to flight controls in a significant number of A320 family aircraft and that the software changes required to fix the issue would lead to operational disruptions

description: Meanwhile, 12 electoral roll observers and one special electoral roll observer have been appointed for the scrutiny of the SIR process in West Bengal

title: Refer Higher Education Commission of India Bill to House panel: Digvijaya Singh
Dare BJP to suspend MPs for chanting Vande Mataram, says Uddha Thackeray
description: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief made the statement four days after the Rajya Sabha Secretariat issued a memorandum reminding members to refrain from chanting slogans in the House

title: Trump claims any document signed by Biden using autopen is 'terminated'
description: In a dramatic turn of events, ex-President Donald Trump has announced the invalidation of executive orders issued by Joe Biden via autopen, alleging misuse of the device. Trump has also issued a stern warning of potential perjury accusations against Biden if he maintains that his staff acted under his orders.

title: Magnitude 5.8 earthquake hits Mexico-Guatemala border, GFZ says
Report on rescued bonded labourers flags rehabilitation failures
Campaigns for MCD bypolls end, BJP pitches ‘development’, AAP questions poll promises
Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller honors late father
description: Utah Mammoth captain Clayton Keller, despite the sudden passing of his father, Bryan, chose to play the very next day against the Dallas Stars. This decision highlights his profound loyalty and inner strength, honoring his father while supporting his team. Coach Andre Tourigny emphasized the organization's unwavering support for Keller, underscoring their family-first approach.

title: ‘Staggering damage’: Thousands of Amazon employees send open letter to CEO; question layoffs
description: Over 1,000 Amazon employees have signed an open letter warning of dire consequences from the company's rapid AI development. They argue Amazon is sacrificing climate goals and its human workforce for AI dominance, citing increased emissions, water consumption for data centers, and job displacement. The workers demand ethical AI practices, including clean energy use and employee involvement in AI decisions.

title: News from the world of Education: November 29, 2025
description: Information on admissions, scholarships, new courses, research studies and other events at schools and colleges

title: ED files prosecution complaint against Kashmir couple under PMLA
description: The ED said the accused Abdul Momin Peer purchased a residential property in Srinagar’s Bemina in the name of his wife for a consideration amount of ₹1.5 crore from the proceeds generated from the crime

title: SC: Will frame rules, menstrual shaming must end, period.
description: The Supreme Court is set to frame guidelines to protect women's health, dignity, and privacy concerning menstruation, prompted by an incident where sanitation workers were forced to prove they were menstruating. The court expressed concern over 'period-shaming' and issued notices to the Centre, acknowledging the SCBA's petition highlighting widespread such violations.

title: 18% GST on air purifiers is unjust, says Kejriwal
Any document signed by Joe Biden with autopen is terminated, says Donald Trump
Nursery admissions: Delhi schools upload criteria on DoE portal
Pollution protest: protesters get bail in one case, sent to jail in another
Kedarnath chopper crash: Report reveals pilot's last words - 'Cannot see anything, turning ...'
description: A pilot's final words, "Cannot see anything, turning…", preceded a fatal helicopter crash near Gaurikund en route to Kedarnath. The Aryan Aviation Bell 407, flying in unpredictable cloud banks, lost visibility and hit a hillside, killing all seven on board. The incident highlights significant weather monitoring shortcomings.

title: Peru’s president to declare border state of emergency to prevent entry of undocumented migrants
Is Giannis Antetokounmpo playing tonight vs Knicks? Latest update
description: Milwaukee faces a crucial NBA Cup game against the Knicks on November 28, 2025, with Giannis Antetokounmpo's availability uncertain due to a left adductor strain.  A six-game losing streak has amplified the pressure on the Bucks, who are desperate for a win to keep their Cup aspirations alive.  Other injuries further complicate their challenge.

title: Key accused in Kapil Sharma restaurant shooting arrested
Why Arundhati is ‘okay clapping for others’ until her time comes
description: The 28-year-old found a way of contributing during India’s World Cup triumph despite not making the XI — her teammates valued her impact on squad morale. She knows she has to start afresh after slipping down the pace-bowling pecking order. But having learnt the lessons of a hard life, she has the wherewithal to deal with setbacks and seize the next opportunity

title: India seals ₹7,995 crore deal with the U.S. for Navy’s MH-60R helicopter fleet support
description: Signing of the contract comes amid strain in ties between the two countries after U.S. President Donald Trump had slapped a whopping 50% tariffs on Indian goods in late August

title: BMTC reduces Vajra AC weekly pass fare to ₹700
No ‘good’ AQI in major cities: 10-year study flags persistent pollution; Delhi tops list
description: A decade-long study reveals no major Indian city met safe air quality standards between 2015 and November 2025. Delhi consistently ranked as the most polluted, with other cities also experiencing unhealthy AQI levels. Vehicular emissions, industrial pollution, and crop burning are identified as key contributors, exacerbated by geographical factors and weather patterns.

title: Lokayukta raids revenue offices in khata bribery case
CeNS scientists make breakthrough in the development of eco-friendly batteries
Afghans in the US urge Trump not to punish community after DC shooting
Woman and her male friend arrested on charge of murdering her husband
DIY abduction fail: Man stages own kidnapping to get ‘rid’ of his pregnant wife; police unravel plot
description: A Lucknow bike mechanic staged his own kidnapping to escape his pregnant wife, paying a minor to deliver a false abduction story. Police uncovered the deception through CCTV footage and surveillance, revealing the man's motive was to 'get rid of her' after frequent arguments.

title: Grief turns to shock: Indian-origin bride's Canada 'accident' now murder
description: A permanent resident in Canada, Mandeep Kaur Grewal, initially reported to have died in a car accident, was allegedly murdered by her brother-in-law. Gurjot Singh Khaira has been charged with second-degree murder and indignity to human remains. The family remains in shock, unaware of the motive behind the alleged killing.

title: NISAR earth observation satellite enters final science operations phase
description: Images from the satellite can be used in various targeted science and application areas such as agriculture, forestry, geo-sciences, Himalayan snow and oceanic studies

title: What Indian women’s tennis needs to bridge the gulf to the elite
description: The Billie Jean King Cup playoffs in Bengaluru came as a reality check — but there were also positives for singles players Sahaja Yamalapalli and Shrivalli Bhamidipaty, who don’t always get to face world-class opposition. What lessons can be learnt from the experience to better empower India’s young players?

description: Air travel faces significant disruption this weekend as over 350 IndiGo and Air India A320 family aircraft in India, and thousands globally, are grounded for a crucial software upgrade. This precautionary measure follows an incident where an A320 unexpectedly pitched downward, potentially due to solar radiation affecting flight control data. The upgrade aims to ensure fleet safety.

Fortnite Zero Hour live event start timings for all regions
description: Fortnite's "Zero Hour" live event on November 29, 2025, will be a massive, Avengers-style showdown concluding the current chapter. This one-time spectacle transitions the game into Chapter 7 Season 1, featuring potential crossovers with Godzilla, Kong, and more. Players are advised to join the event lobby early to secure their spot for this unrepeatable experience.

Oxford Union fiasco: Pak claims false victory after shambolic debate gets cancelled; what happened
description: An Oxford Union debate on India's Pakistan policy was cancelled due to the Pakistan delegation's no-show, leading to accusations of "shambolic management" and the Pakistan High Commission falsely claiming victory. Indian speakers, including J Sai Deepak, were present but refused to debate students instead. The event was marred by last-minute speaker withdrawals and poor communication.

description: The allegations of vote manipulation by opposition parties in Bihar have been thoroughly dismissed by the Election Commission. They confirmed that no requests for EVM verification were logged, and the routine VVPAT audits showed alignment with the official counts.

Mhatre breaks Rohit's record, becomes youngest ever to reach this feat
description: Mumbai's Ayush Mhatre, at 18, has become the youngest cricketer to score centuries in first-class, List A, and T20 formats. He achieved this with an unbeaten 110 off 53 balls in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, surpassing Rohit Sharma's record. This stellar performance also earned him captaincy of the India U19 squad and retention by Chennai Super Kings.

From foreign gifts to crypto ventures, access to power now dictates economic success.  This 'Black Friday presidency' sees reduced enforcement and new pay-to-play schemes, making Washington a transactional hub.

Bo Bichette contract talks pause amid major risks for Toronto Blue Jays
description: MLB analysts are questioning the Toronto Blue Jays' delay in re-signing star Bo Bichette, especially after the team's significant investment in pitcher Dylan Cease. Concerns over Bichette's injury history, including missing substantial time in the 2024 season, are cited as potential reasons for the team's cautious approach to a long-term contract.

title: Rohit & Hardik: Two leadership calls in Agarkar's tenure which were a royal mess
description: Ajit Agarkar’s tenure as chief selector has been marked by dramatic white-ball captaincy shifts, with Rohit Sharma and Hardik Pandya both losing leadership roles. Poor communication, unclear long-term planning, and inconsistent reasoning have fueled discontent within the camp. As India heads into back-to-back ICC events within a year, these bold calls will face their first real test.

title: Maoists offer to disarm by Jan 1; want ops halted; seek safe reintegration
description: Maoist cadres in Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, and Chhattisgarh are ready to lay down arms by January 1, 2026, seeking clear security guarantees and a transparent rehabilitation process. The MMC Special Zonal Committee proposes a collective, organized reunification, not individual surrenders, emphasizing safety for cadres and their families. This offer coincides with intensified anti-Maoist operations and a Union government deadline.

title: NBA rumors: Lakers eye $186M Bucks star as they plan league’s next superteam
description: Whispers are growing louder about the Los Angeles Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo.  Reports suggest the franchise is exploring aggressive moves to build a future around Luka Dončić, even considering significant short-term sacrifices.  Complex multi-team trade scenarios are circulating, aiming to reshape multiple NBA rosters and create new championship contenders.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250bn; claims 'we lead industry'
description: Nvidia's stock plummeted by $250 billion after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering significant spending on Google's competing AI chips. This move signals a potential shift in the AI hardware market, with Google's TPUs emerging as a credible alternative to Nvidia's dominant position.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note to Stephen days after marriage remarks
description: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.
